fused:mcp.description:
Purpose: This UDF analyzes tree canopy heights around any geographic location using satellite-based LiDAR data.
Data Source: Global ALS/GLAS LiDAR dataset (CHM - Canopy Height Model) stored on S3
Method:
- Creates a circular buffer (250m radius) around input coordinates
- Queries the corresponding satellite tile for that location
- Extracts height measurements from the canopy height model
Outputs:
- max_tree_height_m: Tallest tree in the area (42.0m at Vancouver location)
- median_tree_height_m: Middle value of all height measurements (0.0m - indicates >50% ground pixels)
- mean_tree_height_m: Average tree height (4.51m - includes ground pixels)
- buffer_meters: Analysis radius (250m)
- meta_chm_tile_id: Source satellite tile identifier

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude of the location to analyze

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Longitude of the location to analyze
